summary: The Federal Bird Safe Buildings Act of 2025 mandates the Administrator of General Services to incorporate bird-safe features and practices in new, acquired, and significantly altered public buildings to reduce bird fatalities. It requires the development and dissemination of a design guide with best practices and regular updates. Certain buildings, such as those on the National Register of Historic Places, the White House, Supreme Court, and Capitol, are exempt. The Administrator must report compliance to Congress annually.
